# How to install the Angular CLI
 Angular CLI   [Node.js](https://node.js.org/)  Node.js  [Node.js ](https://nodejs.org/en/download/) 

 Node.js  Angular CLI
```bash
npm install -g @angular/cli
```

npm update -g @angular/cli
```

ng new MyApplicationName
```
 enter

# CLI command-language syntax
CLI syntax
```
ng commandNameOrAlias requiredArg [optionalArg] [options]
```
-  command  option 
- () option (-) option 
-  name 
-  option   myOpitonName = my-option-name



# How to use Angular CLI
 Angular CLI  CLI 

## Create Component
 Component  Angular CLI 
```
ng generate component MyComponentName -> 
ng g c MyCompoenntName -> 
```
 Component  module 
```
ng generate component MyComponentName --module MyModuleName
```
## Create Module
 Angular  Module  Module  Module 
```
ng generate module MyModuleName
```
## Create pipes
pipes  Angular  pipes
```
ng generate pipe MyPipeName
```
## Create Services
Services  Angular ...
```
ng generate service MyServiceName
```
## Run project
 Angular 
```
ng serve <project> [options]
ng s <project> [options]
```
 build  serve  App``
## Building project
 build 
```
ng build <project> [options]
ng b <project> [options]
```
## Extract-i18n
Angular  i18n  i18n
```
ng extract-i18n <project> [options]
ng i18n-extract <project> [options]
ng xi18n <project> [options]
```

Post.title: Day3. angular.json
Post._content:
Angular CLI ...

 Angular CLI  Angular CLI  " angular.json " angular.json  Angular workspace root level ` workspace  project  Angular CLI  build  development tool `
> A file named angular.json at the root level of an Angular workspace provides workspace-wide and project-specific configuration defaults for build and development tools provided by the Angular CLI. Path values given in the configuration are relative to the root workspace folder.

![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210821/20124767GwY7OIYgvq.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210821/20124767GwY7OIYgvq.png)

<!--more-->

# Overall JSON structure
 angular.json  angular.json 

angular.json  root  project

root  workspace  workspace

- **version** workspace 
- **newProjectRoot** ng generate application <name>  ng generate library <name> Angular CLI  applicatioon  library
- **defaultProject** ng new <name>  Angular CLI  app  ng server <name> ng server  ng server my-app
- **projects** application  library 
- **schematics** ng generation 

project  CLI 

- **root** project  workspace 
- **sourceroot** source file 
- **projectType** application  libraryCLI  library  application 
- **prefix** selectors  ng generate component  component  prefix  gna ng generate component hello-world  component  selectors  "gna-hello-world"
- **schematics** project  schematics  CSS  SCSS styleext:scss
- **architect** project  architect 

 angular.json file build command
![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210729/20124767znwvhlEFXA.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210729/20124767znwvhlEFXA.png)


# What is Architect ?
 property  Angular app  "Architect"  Angular 
> Architect is the tool that the CLI uses to perform complex tasks, such as compilation and test running

Architect  CLI  compilation  test running Architect  shell target configuration  Builder 

![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210729/20124767ZvVJbw5arN.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210729/20124767ZvVJbw5arN.png)

 `Angular CLI  builder  ""`Architect  builder ` command  Architect  command  builder `



# What is Builders ?
 Architect  Builders Builders  Architect  npm package packageing your libreay  building serving application

 builders  option ( a JSON object ) context ( a BuilderContext object )option object  CLI  context  CLI Builder API 

Angular  CLI  ng build  ng test  builders CLI Builders  angular.json  "Architect"  ng run <targetName> builders



# Understanding the command mapping
![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210729/20124767Stj9kOMC1l.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210729/20124767Stj9kOMC1l.png)

 command  Architect  command  builder  command  Architect  command : ng run projectName:architectTarget

Example: build: ng build...  ng run <projectName>:build

 Architect 

- build: ng build   ng run my-app:build;
- serve: ng serve   ng run my-app:serve;
- e2e: ng e2e   ng run my-app:e2e;
- test: ng test   ng run my-app:test;
- lint: ng lint   ng run my-app:lint;
- extract-i18n: ng xi18n   ng run my-app:xi18n



# Assets configuration
 build target  build 
```JSON
"assets": [
  "src/assets",
  "src/favicon.ico"
]
```

 Assets  Assets  key

- glob node-glob 
- input root 
- output outDir  build  dist / project-name
- ignore glob 
- followSymlinks false

 key  asset 
```JSON
"assets": [
  {
    "glob": "**/*",
    "input": "src/assets/",
    "output": "/assets/"
  },
  {
    "glob": "favicon.ico",
    "input": "src/",
    "output": "/"
  }
]
```

Angular Component ` Angular Component sub-component UI ` Lifecycle UI Component Angular Component DOM Component Template Lifecycle Angular HTML Component selector Component Template UI DOM Component Component ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210730/20124767kIMDJfjDfg.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210730/20124767kIMDJfjDfg.png) # Responding to lifecycle events Lifecycle Lifecycle import `angular/core` lifecycle ```typescript import { Component, OnInit, OnChanges, ... } from '@angular/core'; ``` Lifecycle method `ng` OnInit Lifecycle method TypeScript Class ngOnInit( ) Lifycycle method Class `implements` Lifycycle ```typescript import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-first-component', templateUrl: './first-component.component.html', styleUrls: ['./first-component.component.css'] }) export class FirstComponentComponent implements OnInit { constructor() { } ngOnInit(): void { } } ``` ## Lifecycle event sequence Lifecycle method Angular Lifecycle method Angular Lifecycle method | Name | Purpose | Timing |----------|:-------------:|:-------------:| | ngOnChanges() | Component method | Component ` OnInit() ` @Input | ngOnInit() | Component ngOnChanges Component | ngOnChange() | ngDoCheck() | ` Angular ` ngOnChanges() ngOnInit() | ngOnChanges() ngOnInit() | ngAfterContentInit() | Angular ng-content Component view | ngDoCheck() | ngAfterContentChecked() | ng-content | ngAfterContentInit() ngDoCheck() | ngAfterViewInit() | Angular Component Component view | ngAfterContentChecked() | ngAfterViewChecked() | Component Component | ngAfterViewInit() ngAfterContentChecked() | ngOnDestroy() | Angular directive Component unsubscribe Observable | Angular directive Component ## ngDoCheck() Angular Angular > Detect and act upon changes that Angular cant or wont detect on its own. Called during every change detection run, immediately after ngOnChanges() and ngOnInit() ngOnChanges( ) ngOnInit( ) Component Angular Component check Component - update child component input binding ( @Input( ) ) - update DOM interpolations ( Template {{ value }} ) - update query list Angular Lifecycle Lifycycle ``` ComponentA ComponentB ComponentC ``` Angular ``` Checking A component: - update B input bindings - call NgDoCheck on the B component - update DOM interpolations for component A Checking B component: - update C input bindings - call NgDoCheck on the C component - update DOM interpolations for component B Checking C component: - update DOM interpolations for component C ``` DoCheck ngDoCheck ComponentB onPush ``` Checking A component: - update B input bindings - call NgDoCheck on the B component - update DOM interpolations for component A if (bindings changed) -> checking B component: - update C input bindings - call NgDoCheck on the C component - update DOM interpolations for component B Checking C component: - update DOM interpolations for component C ``` ComponenB false ` Angular ` ComponentB ComponentB ngDoCheck sub-component ```typescript @Component({ selector: 'app-first-component', template: '

The name is: {{o.name}}

', changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush // (1) }) export class FirstComponentComponent implements OnChanges { @Input() o: { id: number; name: string; } = { id: NaN, name: '' }; // (2) id: number = NaN; ngOnChanges() { console.log('first-component OnChange() been call'); // (3) this.id = this.o.id; } ngDoCheck() { console.log('first-component DoCheck() been call'); // (4) if (this.id !== this.o.id) { this.cd.markForCheck(); } } } ``` - 1 OnPush - 2 @Input( ) input binding - 3 @Input( ) sub-component ngOnChanges - 4 sub-component ngDoCheck o sub-component2 name id ```typescript @Component({ selector: 'app-root', template: `

Component host bindings 1. **Property binding**: `host: {'[class.foo]': 'hasFoo'} or host: {'[style.color]': 'color'}` 2. **Map binding**: `host: {'[class]': 'classExpr'} or host: {'[style]': 'styleExpr'}` 3. **Static value**: `host: {'class': 'foo'} or host: {'style': 'color: blue'}` CSS class style CSS class[class.foo] [class] [class] [style.bar] [style] # Two-way binding attribute, class, style binding binding `Two-way binding` @Input() @Output() HTML property porperty binding ( [ ] ) event binding EventEmitter method ```html ``` ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210805/20124767zQSQyFVxiV.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210805/20124767zQSQyFVxiV.png) @Input() @Output() Angular `Two-way binding` property binding event binding `[()]` ```html ``` # How two-way binding works Two-way binding @Output() property `inputChange` input @Input() @Input() size @Output() sizeChange 1. child.component.ts @Input() size @Output() sizeChange method ```typescript import { Component, Input, Output, EventEmitter } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-child', templateUrl: './child.component.html', styleUrls: ['./child.component.css'], }) export class ChildComponent { @Input() size!: number | string; // (1) @Output() sizeChange = new EventEmitter(); // (2) constructor() {} dec() { // (3) this.resize(-1); } inc() { // (4) this.resize(+1); } resize(delta: number) { // (5) this.size = Math.min(40, Math.max(8, +this.size + delta)); this.sizeChange.emit(this.size); } } ``` - (1): @Input() size - (2): @Output() sizeChange EventEmitter - (3): - (4): - (5): method 2. child.component.html text interpolation size template ```html

Writing structural directives date: 2021-09-16 10:05:45 tags: - Angular - Front-end categories: - 2021 --- attribute directive structural directives ![img](https://www.theagilityeffect.com/app/uploads/2019/03/00_VINCI-ICONOGRAPHIE-GettyImages-890132412_1280x680.jpg) # Creating a structural directive Angular `UnlessDirective` `UnlessDirective` *ngIf true NgIf `UnlessDirective` 1. Angular CLI directive ```bash ng generate directive unless ng g d unless ``` 2. `@angular/core` `Input`, `TemplateRef`, `ViewContainerRef` ```typescript import { Directive, Input, TemplateRef, ViewContainerRef } from '@angular/core'; @Directive({ selector: '[appUnless]'}) export class UnlessDirective { } ``` 3. unless.directive.ts constructor inject TemplateRef ViewContainerRef ```typescript import { Directive, Input, TemplateRef, ViewContainerRef } from '@angular/core'; @Directive({ selector: '[appUnless]' }) export class UnlessDirective { constructor( private templateRef: TemplateRef, private viewContainer: ViewContainerRef ) {} } ``` UnlessDirective Angular `` embedded view element `TemplateRef` `` ViewContainerRef view container **Note**: embedded view ng-template view node view component template view` component ` view view 4. unless.directive.ts property setter appUnless property ```typescript import { Directive, Input, TemplateRef, ViewContainerRef } from '@angular/core'; @Directive({ selector: '[appUnless]' }) export class UnlessDirective { private hasView = false; // (1) constructor( private templateRef: TemplateRef, private viewContainer: ViewContainerRef ) {} @Input() set appUnless(condition: boolean) { // (2) if (!condition && !this.hasView) { this.viewContainer.createEmbeddedView(this.templateRef); this.hasView = true; } else { this.viewContainer.clear(); this.hasView = false; } } } ``` - (1): property - (2): setter property condition true viewContainer embedded view templateRef false 5. app.component.ts property method ```typescript import { Component } from '@angular/core'; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.css'] }) export class AppComponent { condition = false; // (1) onClick() { // (2) this.condition = !this.condition; } } ``` - (1): property structural directive - (2): method condition 6. app.component.html directive ```html

Angular Form Form Form Angular `reactive` `template-driven` view ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210821/20124767cYDUalx1rV.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210821/20124767cYDUalx1rV.png) # Choosing an approach `Reactive forms` `template-driven forms` - **Reactive forms** object - **Template-driven forms** template directive object`` ## Key differences `Reactive forms` `template-driven forms` | | Description | Reactive | |----------|:-------------:|:-------------:| | Setup of form model | Component | directive | Data model | | | Data flow | | | Form validation | function | directive ## Scalability Form Form Component Reactive forms template-driven forms `` API view `` Reactive forms Template-driven forms `` API view `` API # Setting up the form model `Reactive forms` `template-driven forms` Component ## Common form foundation classes Reactive forms template-dirven forms base classes - **FormControl**`` `` - **FormGroup**`` javeascript object FormControl FormArray FormGroup - **FormArray** FormControl - **ControlValueAccessor** Angular FormControl instnce DOM ## Setup in reactive forms reactive forms component `[formControl]` directive `internal value accessor` FormControl intance view 1. app.module.ts Form module ```typescript import { NgModule } from '@angular/core'; import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser'; import { AppRoutingModule } from './app-routing.module'; import { AppComponent } from './app.component'; import { FormsModule, ReactiveFormsModule } from '@angular/forms'; @NgModule({ declarations: [ AppComponent, ], imports: [ BrowserModule, AppRoutingModule, FormsModule, ReactiveFormsModule ], providers: [], bootstrap: [AppComponent] }) export class AppModule { } ``` 2. app.component.ts FormControl ```typescript import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { FormControl } from '@angular/forms'; // (1) @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', }) export class AppComponent { favoriteColorControl = new FormControl(''); // (2) } ``` - (1): `@angular/forms` FormControl - (2): FormControl component property 3. app.component.html ```html

Post._content: Angular Form Template-driven forms ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210823/20124767lIolI8gw9s.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210823/20124767lIolI8gw9s.png) # What is Template-driven forms? Template-driven forms template HTML template directive attribute template component reactive forms Template-driven forms - Form `ngForm` directive - `ngModel` directive - ngModel template component property - template directive template-driven forms - component - reactive forms - - # Building a template-driven form template-driven form template form template-driven form template component property (![/images/emoticon/emoticon07.gif](/images/emoticon/emoticon07.gif) # Import FormsModule app.module.ts `@angular/form` `FormsModule` app.module metadata `imports` ```typescript import { NgModule } from '@angular/core'; import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser'; import { AppRoutingModule } from './app-routing.module'; import { AppComponent } from './app.component'; import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms'; @NgModule({ declarations: [ AppComponent, ], imports: [ BrowserModule, AppRoutingModule, FormsModule, ], providers: [], bootstrap: [AppComponent] }) export class AppModule { } ``` # Build the basic form form form form class ```typescript // hero.ts export class Hero { id!: number; name!: string; power!: string; alterEgo?: string; constructor(id: number, name: string, power: string, alterEgo?: string) { this.id = id; this.name = name; this.power = power; this.alterEgo = alterEgo; } } ``` `Hero` class `new` object Angular CLI component form ```bash ng generate component hero-form ``` component hero-form.component.ts form ```typescript import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core'; import { Hero } from '../hero'; // (1) @Component({ selector: 'app-hero-form', templateUrl: './hero-form.component.html', styleUrls: ['./hero-form.component.css'], }) export class HeroFormComponent implements OnInit { powers = ['Really Smart', 'Super Flexible', 'Super Hot', 'Weather Changer']; // (2) model = new Hero(18, 'Dr IQ', this.powers[0], 'Chuck Overstreet'); // (3) submitted = false; constructor() {} ngOnInit(): void {} onSubmit() { // (4) this.submitted = true; } } ``` - (1): Hero class - (2): property array - (3): new Hero object property model - (4): method submit app-hero.component.ts selector app.component.html ```html ``` hero-form.component view `

import { FormControl, FormGroup, Validators } from '@angular/forms'; @Component({ selector: 'app-reactive', templateUrl: './reactive.component.html', styleUrls: ['./reactive.component.css'], }) export class ReactiveComponent implements OnInit { hero = new FormGroup({ // (1) name: new FormControl('', [Validators.required, Validators.minLength(4)]), }); constructor() {} ngOnInit(): void {} errorDetect() { return this.name?.invalid && (this.name.touched || this.name.dirty); // (2) } getErrorType (): string { // (3) if (this.name?.errors !== null) { if (this.name?.errors.required) { return 'required'; } else if (this.name?.errors.minlength) { return 'minlength'; } } return ''; } get name() { // (4) return this.hero.get('name'); } } ``` - (1): FormGroup FormControl - (2): method name - (3): method name - (4): get property name FormControl 2. reactive.component.html FormControl ```html

Post._content:
Angular `i18n` `Localization` Angular i18n - `pipes` - template - - Angular i18n Angular CLI Angular CLI - Angular CLI source language file - - Angular CLI ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767LCHVMC00vy.jpg](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767LCHVMC00vy.jpg) # Add the localize package Angular CLI Angular CLI `@angular/localize` ```bash ng add @angular/localize ``` CLI Command `package.json` `polyfill.ts` `@angular/localize` i18n # Refer to locales by ID Angular i18n `Unicode` (ID) ```/` ID `en` `fr` ` ( - )` `` US CA `en-US` fr-CA Angular ID Angular `en-US` `angular.json` `sourceLocale` # Prepare templates for translations Angular i18n template Angular i18n attribute attribute 1. 2. 3. 4. attribute 5. ## Mark text for translations `i18n` attribute template ```html

Hello i18n!

``` `

` i18n attribute ```html

Hello i18n!

``` ## Add helpful descriptions and meanings i18n attribute ```html

Hello i18n!

``` i18n attribute `|` ` | ` ```html

Hello i18n!

``` ## Translate text not for display `` ```html I don't output any element ``` ## Mark element attributes for translations HTML attribute `` title attribute i18n `-` attribute ```html ``` HTML attribute `i18n-attribute` attribute attribute ```html ``` `i18n-attribute=" | @@"` ID # Mark plurals and alternates for translation `` `Unicode`ICU ## Mark plurals `plural` `updated x minutes ago` `jest now``one minute ago` `x minutes ago` ```html Updated {minutes, plural, =0 {just now} =1 {one minute ago} other {{{minutes}} minutes ago}} ``` - `minutes` component property - `plural` - - property minutes 0 `=0 { just now }` - property minutes 1 `=1 { one minute ago }` - property ## Mark alternates and nested expressions `select` `plural` template component property property `male``female` `other` ```html The author is {gender, select, male {male} female {female} other {other}} ``` ```html Updated: {minutes, plural, =0 {just now} =1 {one minute ago} other {{{minutes}} minutes ago by {gender, select, male {male} female {female} other {other}}}} ``` # Learn by example i18n ## Create component ```bash ng generate component form ``` ## Complete the form component 1. form.component.ts Form Model ```typescript import { Component } from '@angular/core'; import { FormBuilder, Validators } from '@angular/forms'; @Component({ selector: 'app-form', templateUrl: './form.component.html', styleUrls: ['./form.component.css'] }) export class FormComponent { form = this.fb.group({ username: ['', Validators.required], password: ['', Validators.required], }) constructor(private fb: FormBuilder) { } } ``` 2. form.component.html FormControl `i18n` ```html
``` ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767IvMMcvJsHE.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767IvMMcvJsHE.png) ## Generate language files template Angular CLI `extract-i18n` command tempalte source language file ```bash ng extract-i18n ``` extract-i18n `XML` `messages.xlf` source language file option - -output-path soruce language file - format soruce language file - outFile soruce language file `--format` soruce language file ```bash ng extract-i18n --format=xlf ng extract-i18n --format=xlf2 ng extract-i18n --format=xmb ng extract-i18n --format=json ng extract-i18n --format=arb ``` ## Translate various languages source language file Angular ### Translate chinese source language file `messages.zh.hant.xlf` ```xml Username src/app/form/form.component.html 3 Password src/app/form/form.component.html 5 Login src/app/form/form.component.html 9 ``` `` `` ### Translate Japanese ```xml Username src/app/form/form.component.html 3 Password src/app/form/form.component.html 5 Login src/app/form/form.component.html 9 ``` ## Merge translations into the app angular.json Angular ```json { ... "projects": { "project-name": { "i18n": { "locales": { "tw": { "translation": "messages.zh.hant.xlf", "baseHref": "/tw/" }, "jp": { "translation": "messages.jp.xlf", "baseHref": "/jp/" } } } } } } ``` build ```json "architect": { "build": { ... "options": { "localize": true, "aot": true, ... }, "configurations": { "tw": { "localize": ["tw"] }, "jp": { "localize": ["jp"] }, } } } ``` serve ```json "serve": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server", "configurations": { "production": { "browserTarget": "Angular-blog:build:production" }, "tw": { "browserTarget": "Angular-blog:build:tw" }, "jp": { "browserTarget": "Angular-blog:build:jp" }, "development": { "browserTarget": "Angular-blog:build:development" } } } ``` ## Test i18n Angular CLI ```bash ng serve --configuration=tw --open ``` ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767LkrRPBsZbj.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767LkrRPBsZbj.png) ```bash ng serve --configuration=jp --open ``` ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767V3j0Qi41tg.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767V3j0Qi41tg.png) select ![img](https://i.imgur.com/WQY5zIG.gif) # Angular i18n template i18n attribute Angular CLI Command `ng extract-i18n` source langange file source langange file `` `` angular.json i18n Angular `Module` module app.module.ts Module # Reference - [Angular.io - Localizing your app](https://angular.io/guide/i18n#plurals-alternates)

"options": { "localize": true, "aot": true, ... }, "configurations": { "tw": { "localize": ["tw"] }, "jp": { "localize": ["jp"] }, } } } ``` serve ```json "serve": { "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server", "configurations": { "production": { "browserTarget": "Angular-blog:build:production" }, "tw": { "browserTarget": "Angular-blog:build:tw" }, "jp": { "browserTarget": "Angular-blog:build:jp" }, "development": { "browserTarget": "Angular-blog:build:development" } } } ``` ## Test i18n Angular CLI ```bash ng serve --configuration=tw --open ``` ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767LkrRPBsZbj.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767LkrRPBsZbj.png) ```bash ng serve --configuration=jp --open ``` ![https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767V3j0Qi41tg.png](https://ithelp.ithome.com.tw/upload/images/20210828/20124767V3j0Qi41tg.png) select ![img](https://i.imgur.com/WQY5zIG.gif) # Angular i18n template i18n attribute Angular CLI Command `ng extract-i18n` source langange file source langange file `` `` angular.json i18n Angular `Module` module app.module.ts Module # Reference - [Angular.io - Localizing your app](https://angular.io/guide/i18n#plurals-alternates)
